newsitem.title: USA: Fannie Mae plans homeowner insurance - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Fannie Mae plans homeowner insurance - WSJ.

text.p: Fannie Mae is thinking about giving away insurance to homeowners to pay off their mortgages if they became disabled or died, the Wall Street Journal said on Tuesday in its electronic edition.
Fannie Mae said it would unveil the plan within weeks but details were not available, the newspaper said.
According to preliminary internal documents, lenders would have the option of offering insurance to homebuyers when they applied for mortgages, the newspaper said.
The company was not immediately available to comment.
